item.title: Assassin's Creed Shadows Delayed Again
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/ubisoft-assassins-creed-shadows-delay-march-february-1851736266

Ubisoft has announced that Assassin’s Creed Shadows has been delayed again. The open-world stealth game was set to arrive in February following its initial delay in September 2024, but now it won’t launch until March 20.

Suggested Reading

Is Alan Wake Worth Playing Before Its Sequel? | Total Recall

  • Off
  • English

Suggested Reading

Assassin’s Creed Shadows was formally announced in May 2024, and was intended to arrive last year in November. The next entry in Ubisoft’s popular and long-running series, Shadows takes the Assassin’s Creed formula to Japan, a location fans have wanted for years. It also has two playable protagonists, a feature last seen in 2015's Assassin’s Creed Syndicate. However, one of these characters—famous Black samurai Yasuke—was at the center of a manufactured controversy among parts of the internet over his race and depiction in the game.

There were also legitimate concerns about how the game looked and played in previews, and following the mixed reception to Star Wars Outlaws last year, Ubisoft announced an uncharateristic delay for the franchise, pushing Assassin’s Creed Shadows back from November 2024 to February 2025 to provide the devs with more time to improve the game. And now it’s been delayed again.

On January 9, Ubisoft announced Shadows would now release on March 20, 2025. In a statement posted online, Ubisoft says that it believes these “few additional weeks” are necessary to implement fan feedback and “ensure an even more ambitious and engaging day-one experience.”

“We remain committed to delivering a high-quality, immersive experience—fostered by ongoing dialogue between our players and development teams,” said Ubisoft. “We know you’re eager to learn more about Assassin’s Creed Shadows, and we’re excited to share that more updates will be coming your way very soon!”

Bloomberg reporter Jason Schreier further added that Ubisoft says its looking at “various transformational strategic and capitalistic options to extract the best value for stakeholders,” aka it’s looking for someone to buy them. Ubisoft CEO Yves Guillemot said in a press release: “We are convinced that there are several potential paths to generate value from Ubisoft’s assets and franchises.”

Assassin’s Creed Shadows is now set to launch on PS5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC on March 20, 2025. It will be the first game in the franchise to skip PS4 in over a decade.

.
